creditline: Gift of Mr. Augustus L. Searle
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: Urn-shaped, slender neck; no decoration, rim diam. 3-3/16 in.
text: Bronze vessels for flower arrangements are considered appropriate for the most formal tea gatherings, and as such are placed on finely lacquered boards that are placed in the center of the tokonoma. This Korean vase, with its understated elegance and handsome patina, would have accorded well with tea taste.
title: Vase
